msgSnippet: Sounds like a classpath problem.  Make sure your test classes are in the classpath. Mike ... __________________________________________________ Do You Yahoo!?

From: Mike Clark <mike@...>

Sounds like a classpath problem.  Make sure your test classes are in
the classpath.

Mike


--- "Nisius, Michael" <michael.nisius@...> wrote:
> Hi, 
> we are doing our first steps with Junit and are trying to start tests
> from
> the command prompt using the graphical TestRunner. Junit keeps
> telling us
> that he is unable to find the test classes. 
> 
> Does it has anything to do with setting the classpath right, or could
> it be
> a problem with the TestClass itself.  The tests that come with the
> JUnit
> distribution are found without any problems. Any suggestions?
> 
> Michael
